data.text: control gained by enforcing obedience or order
examples: struggled to maintain discipline in the classroom
The troops were praised for their dedication and discipline.
lacked the discipline to practice regularly
was responsible for meting out discipline
… keep the discipline of putting money toward your savings regularly.
Practicing running at this marathon pace … will be good discipline.
academic disciplines
Across the Games, around 10,500 athletes competed in 48 sports disciplines.
following the disciplines of priesthood

data.text: to punish or penalize as a means of enforcing obedience and perfecting moral character
examples: debates about the proper way to discipline a child
was disciplined for misbehaving in class
a player repeatedly disciplined by the league
I'm trying to discipline myself to exercise each morning.
discipline troops
Serious writers discipline and refine their writing styles.

data.text: to train or develop by instruction and exercise especially in self-control
examples: debates about the proper way to discipline a child
was disciplined for misbehaving in class
a player repeatedly disciplined by the league
I'm trying to discipline myself to exercise each morning.
discipline troops
Serious writers discipline and refine their writing styles.

a player repeatedly disciplined by the league

discipline troops

data.text: correction or regulation of oneself for the sake of improvement
combining or involving more than one discipline or field of study: multidisciplinary
examples: … leadership challenges in a multidiscipline department …
A $20,000 grant … helped the staff develop a large, multidiscipline area divided into areas focusing on science, technology, math, language arts, art, music and engineering …

The system is designed to support multidiscipline classroom use, change the table height to adapt to a particular activity, integrate the latest teaching technology, meet ADA requirements, and decrease the size required for science classrooms.

data.text: a discipline (such as an academic discipline) that is part of a broader discipline
examples: Organic chemistry is a subdiscipline of chemistry.
The management of programmers is a discipline unto itself. There are subdisciplines that deal with how coders communicate.
